meanings.definition: To pull something with a quick, sharp movement.
meanings.sent1: She tugged the rope to close the door tightly.
meanings.sent2: He tugged on his friend's sleeve to get attention.
meanings.sent3: The kitten tugged playfully at the yarn ball.
meanings.sent4: The wind tugged at the branches of the tree all night.
meanings.sent5: The child tugged with all his might to move the heavy box.

meanings.definition: To struggle or exert force in pulling something.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman tugged hard to reel in a big catch.
meanings.sent2: She tugged at the stuck zipper until it finally moved.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tugged eagerly at the leash during the walk.
meanings.sent4: The hiker tugged the heavy backpack up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The team tugged together to move the boulder out of the way.

meanings.sent1: She tugged the suitcase along the platform.
meanings.sent2: He tugged the rope to secure the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent3: The child tugged at his mother's hand to show her something.
meanings.sent4: The worker tugged the cart filled with tools across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The dog tugged excitedly at the toy during playtime.
